instructions: Image titled Delete Contacts on an iPhone Step 1 1 Open Contacts. It's an app with a person-shaped silhouette on a grey background and colored tabs along the right side. Alternatively, you can access Contacts from the Phone app by tapping the Contacts icon at the bottom of the screen. Image titled Delete Contacts on an iPhone Step 2 2 Tap a contact's name. Doing so will open their contact page. To search for a specific contact, tap the Search bar at the top of the screen and type in their name. Image titled Delete Contacts on an iPhone Step 3 3 Tap . It's in the upper-right corner of the screen. Doing so will allow you to make changes to this person's contact page, including deleting the contact altogether. Image titled Delete Contacts on an iPhone Step 4 4 Scroll down and tap . It's at the bottom of the contact's page. Image titled Delete Contacts on an iPhone Step 5 5 Tap again when prompted. You'll see this prompt at the bottom of the screen. After doing so, the contact will be deleted from your iPhone. You won't see a "Delete" option for contacts added from other apps like Facebook . If your iPhone is connected to your iCloud account , the contact will be deleted on all your connected devices. Advertisement

Image titled Delete Contacts on an iPhone Step 6 1 Open Settings. It's a grey app containing gears ( ) that's typically located on the home screen. Image titled Delete Contacts on an iPhone Step 7 2 Tap your Apple ID. It's the section at the top of the menu that contains your name and image if you've added one. If you are not signed in, tap Sign in to (Your Device) , enter your Apple ID and password, then tap Sign In . If you are running an older version of iOS, you may not need to do this step. Image titled Delete Contacts on an iPhone Step 8 3 Tap . It's in the second section of the menu. Image titled Delete Contacts on an iPhone Step 9 4 Slide "Contacts" to the "Off" position. It will turn white, and you will be prompted to delete all of the iCloud contacts stored locally on your iPhone. Image titled Delete Contacts on an iPhone Step 10 5 Tap . All of the contacts that you had synced with your iCloud account will be deleted from your iPhone. These contacts include any locally saved information (e.g., manually added contacts). Advertisement

Image titled Delete Contacts on an iPhone Step 11 1 Open Settings. It's a grey app containing gears ( ) that's typically located on the home screen. Image titled Delete Contacts on an iPhone Step 12 2 Scroll down and tap . You'll find it about a third of the way down the Settings page. Image titled Delete Contacts on an iPhone Step 13 3 Tap . It's at the top of the page. Image titled Delete Contacts on an iPhone Step 14 4 Tap an email account. At the very least, you'll see iCloud on this page. For example, you'd tap Gmail to open your Contacts settings for a Gmail account. Image titled Delete Contacts on an iPhone Step 15 5 Slide the "Contacts" to the "Off" position. It will turn white, signifying that the contacts from your selected email account are no longer appearing in your iPhone's Contacts app. Advertisement

Image titled Delete Contacts on an iPhone Step 16 1 Open your iPhone's Settings. It's the grey app containing gears ( ) that's typically located on the home screen. Image titled Delete Contacts on an iPhone Step 17 2 Scroll down and tap . You'll find it about a third of the way down the Settings page. Image titled Delete Contacts on an iPhone Step 18 3 Slide "Contacts Found in Apps" to the "Off" position. It's at the bottom of the screen; the button will turn white. You'll no longer see contact suggestions from apps in your iPhone's Contacts app or in the autocomplete field for Messages and Mail. Advertisement

Image titled Delete Contacts on an iPhone Step 19 1 Separate your contacts into groups. You can create groups for your family, your business associates, your friends from the gym, etc. That way, you can hide entire categories of contacts from the list without having to remove them completely. To manage groups, tap the Groups button at the top-left of the Contacts screen. Image titled Delete Contacts on an iPhone Step 20 2 Tap the groups you want to hide. When they are checked, they are visible. When they're unchecked, they'll be hidden from your contact list. Image titled Delete Contacts on an iPhone Step 21 3 Tap when finished. Your contact list will now only display the groups you have chosen. Advertisement
